org.ajoberstar.semver.vcs

Class Stage

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ajoberstar.semver.vcs.Stage
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Stage>

    public final class Stage
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Stage>
    The stage of development represented by the VCS currently.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Stage(java.lang.String name, Versioner versioner)
      Constructs a stage.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int compareTo(Stage that)
      Comparison is performed solely based on the name.
      boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
      Equality is determined solely based on the name of the stage.
      static Stage finalStage()
      Final stage will use only the normal version from the base and remove all other information.
      static Stage fixedStage(java.lang.String name)
      Fixed stages will always use pre-release information of the form <stage name>.<incremented count>, where the count is always 1, unless the previous version used the same stage.
      static Stage floatingStage(java.lang.String name)
      Floating stages will behave as a fixed stage if the previous versions stage either doesn't exist or has a lower precedence.

      Gets the name of this stage.

      Gets the versioner for this stage.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Stage that)
        Comparison is performed solely based on the name. Names are ordered by normal lexicographical order, with the exception of "final" being considered the highest precedence.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Stage>
        Parameters:
        that -
        Returns:

      • finalStage

        public static Stage finalStage()
        Final stage will use only the normal version from the base and remove all other information.
        Returns:
        the final stage

      • fixedStage

        public static Stage fixedStage(java.lang.String name)
        Fixed stages will always use pre-release information of the form <stage name>.<incremented count>, where the count is always 1, unless the previous version used the same stage. In that case the count will be incremented from the previous.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the stage
        Returns:
        a fixed stage

      • floatingStage

        public static Stage floatingStage(java.lang.String name)
        Floating stages will behave as a fixed stage if the previous versions stage either doesn't exist or has a lower precedence. If the previous has a higher precedence, the pre-release information will be of the form <previous stage>.<previous count>.<stage name>.<incremented count>.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the stage
        Returns:
        a floating stage

      • snapshotStage

        public static Stage snapshotStage()
        Snapshot stage will always set the pre-release information to SNAPSHOT.
        Returns:
        the snapshot stage
